description.narrative:
Let's Talk, I Can project aims to promote gender equality and promote equal economic opportunities for both indigenous women and meas well as to promote enhancement of gender roles and standards for indigenous women and men, eliminate restricting standards. Binti Filamu Foundation during and at the end of this project aims to seek changes in various forms towards gender equality. First, increased in the number of indigenous women engaging in small farming, increase access to low-quality seedlings, farm machinery, marketing information, and agronomic advice. Since Binti Filamu Foundation intends to establish a farm hub, thus, among the changes includemore than 100-150 smallholder indigenous farmers to be linked to 15- 25 buyers within and outside the area. This will include smallto medium buyers, processors, and export companies.
The activities that will be implemented in this project include to engage 100 unprivileged indigenous women engaging in small farming, and build capacity among faith and cultural leaders, and feminist towards working together to advocate for women’s ownership on productive resources as well as raising awareness to the community on the same.The project further aims to creative a film and podcast to showcase the role of faith and cultural leaders, and feminist collaboratively in the realization of women’s rights to property especially land for economic empowerment. Also, intends to create campaign for women’s rights on property ownership and lastly the establishment of farm hub program for women engaged in farming. Farm hub will be serving as a resource for education, demonstration, networking, and research to build resilient economic empowerment for women infarm field.

participating-org.narrative:
YOUTH EMPOWERMENT AND MINDSET CHANGE ORGANIZATION (YEMCO) YEMCO is a Non-Government Organisation founded on 8th July 2015 with registration number 00NGO/08670, of Non-Government Organisation Act No. 24 of 2002. The organization focuses on the empowermentand mindset change to youth, women and disabled in order to enable themselves in various development programmes and opportunities. In order to achieve the main objective, the organization provides education and awareness through conduction of numerous trainings and motivation talks to youth, women and disabled. YEMCO collaborates with various community development programmes essentially in touching the lives of youth, women and disabled.
Since its inception in 2015 YEMCO has managed to establish sixty(60) village community banks (VICOBA) in Dar es salaam. The 60 VICOBA are managed and led by YEMCO and youth themselve. YEMCO has manage to provide 10 training each month to young people on entrepreneurship skills, life and leadership skills, in total since its inception it has managed to conduct more than 300 training to youth in Dar es salaam and across other regions in Tanzania such as Arusha and Moshi. YEMCO has benign conducting various programs byself-funding through membership fees and other voluntary contribution, still vision to grow and reach to more people.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to social and political participation

description.narrative: CSOs representing excluded and marginalised individuals have strengthened capacity and maintain and expand their civic space.
CSOs with improved organizational and technical capacity to act and to maintain and expand civic space
CSOs with improved organizational and technical capacity to act in favour of equality and equity
